</image>   <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;7405e125.1503">   <title>Organisations can't thrive and grow if everyone in them thinks and behaves the same way </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;7405e125.1503</link>   <description> Click here&lt;http://www.neilstewartemails.co.uk/display.php?M=196092&amp;C=ecdbccbfdd1831a683b90c0af0297848&amp;S=228&amp;L=2&amp;N=48&gt; to view in browser<br><br>Annual Call for Papers and Panel Proposals<br><br>Global Equality and Diversity (GED)<br><br>?<br><br>Conference and Broadcast<br><br>November 12th 2015, London UK<br><br>&quot;Organisations can't thrive and grow if everyone in them thinks and behaves the same way&quot;<br><br>If this is the Chinese Century how many FTSE 100 Directors identified themselves as of Chinese origin? Watch here to find out.&lt;http://www.neilstewartemails.co.uk/link.php?M=196092&amp;N=228&amp;L=236&amp;F=H&gt; Trevor Phillips OBE, Former Chair of EHRC UK. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T08:47:35+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Adam Eardley</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;7405e125.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;141415c3.1501">   <title>CALL - Integrating Curricular and Ethics related Co-curricular Endeavors </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;141415c3.1501</link>   <description> Integrating Curricular and Co-Curricular Endeavors to Enhance Intellectual,<br>Intercultural, Global, Community, and Personal Student Outcomes<br><br>Charles Wankel, St John's University, New York, and Laura A. Wankel,<br>Northeastern University, Boston<br><br>Call for Chapter proposals<br><br>In too many ways higher education is still a series of silo-like endeavors<br>rather than collaborative integrated fabrics. Integrating classroom learning<br>with out of class experience designed to produce significant outcomes<br>remains elusive and haphazard. Evidence that significant student learning<br>and development takes place in multiple venues such as internships, service<br>learning, clubs and organizations, student employment etc. invites<br>thoughtful integration of intellectual, personal, and behavioral linkages<br> [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-11T15:43:17-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Charles Wankel</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;141415c3.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;da282a1c.1412">   <title>Lidl & Procter & Gamble </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;da282a1c.1412</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>I saw an article which seems to have a claim that Procter &amp; Gamble is<br>supposedly socially responsible. This was on Page 7 of the issue<br>supposedly dated 11th December 2014 (but I actually got my copy on 8th<br>December 2014) of the gratis newspaper &quot;Dica da Semana&quot; published by<br>the Portuguese section of the supermarket chain Lidl (sic):<br>&quot;Procter &amp; Gamble<br>Marcas como a Fairy, a Gillette e a Pante-<br>ne, representadas pela Procter &amp; Gamble,<br>t\ufffd\ufffdm diversos exemplos de responsabilidade<br>social. Destaca-se o programa Barba do<br>Bem, onde a Gillette apoia programas edu-<br>cacionais desenvolvidos no [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-12T17:41:45+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Colin Paul Gloster</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;da282a1c.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;4c3b82a.1411">   <title>CFP Philosophy of Management Conference 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;4c3b82a.1411</link>   <description> (Please forward this to anyone who would be interested. Thank you.<br>Apologies for any cross-postings)<br><br>Call for Papers<br><br>PHILOSOPHY OF MANAGEMENT 2015<br><br>The 10th Philosophy of Management International Conference 2015<br><br>St Anne's College Oxford<br><br>9 - 12 July 2015<br><br>Organised by Philosophy of Management<br><br>Sponsored by University of Greenwich Business School<br><br>Philosophy of Management 2015 is the tenth in a series of conferences open<br>to all. It will be of special interest to philosophers, management<br>researchers and teachers, consultants and practising managers. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-24T17:29:09-00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Nigel Laurie</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;4c3b82a.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;88247e9f.1411">   <title>Re: [RESEARCHETHICS] "we ensure that your degree is highly regarded, both nationally and internationally" </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;88247e9f.1411</link>   <description> David proposed:<br>|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|<br>|&quot;I am not sure why you are emailing to this list it appears to be a private matter.&quot;|<br>|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|<br><br>Dear David,<br><br>Visibility aids accountability. Cf. the court victory of Dr. Carolyn<br>Phinney versus the so-called University of Michigan, and contrast that<br>with a court case of Dr. Marianne Zorza versus the same defendant<br>slightly earlier but with much less coverage by media (e.g.<br>WWW.Albany.edu/~scifraud/scilog/scilog93_page1.html<br>). [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-19T16:38:56+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Colin Paul Gloster</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;88247e9f.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;f3616532.1411">   <title>"we ensure that your degree is highly regarded, both nationally and internationally" </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;f3616532.1411</link>   <description> Dear Mr. Fergal MacErlean,<br><br>Ms. Elsa Vieira de Andrade Rodrigues is a lawyer who represents me on<br>my first (and still ongoing) court case over DCU\ufffd\ufffds failure to honour<br>its promise &quot;we ensure that your degree is highly regarded, both<br>nationally and internationally&quot; (<br>WWW4.DCU.Ie/prospective/10-reasons-choose-dcu.shtml<br>) over a doctoral scholarship which I was rejected for during 2008 by<br>the Portuguese Foundation for Science and Technology solely on the<br>basis that this non-funding agency claimed that my degree from DCU<br>(which DCU claims is a IIi) was supposedly a D or E. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-18T20:50:06+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Colin Paul Gloster</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;f3616532.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;431afaf8.1411">   <title>Business Case Request - Paid </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;431afaf8.1411</link>   <description> SAGE Business Cases is an informative new online offering from SAGE. The<br>collection, consisting of business and management case studies, associated<br>teaching notes and videos will be hosted on SAGE\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds premier eBook platform,<br>SAGE Knowledge, and will be made available to academic libraries on a<br>global basis, allowing for institution-wide online access to every case<br>study. Golson Media, producer of this project, offers an honorarium of<br>$150. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-12T12:39:30-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Kara Ward</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;431afaf8.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;d5e5ed65.1411">   <title>Students murdered in Mexico over unfair funding practice </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;d5e5ed65.1411</link>   <description> Wow. These reports make what happened to me and what is happening to me<br>seem insignificant . . .<br>HTTP://En.Wikipedia.org/wiki/2014_Iguala_mass_kidnapping<br><br>WWW.WashingtonPost.com/news/morning-mix/wp/2014/10/06/charred-bodies-found-in-the-land-of-the-wicked-may-be-missing-mexican-students/<br><br>WWW.BBC.com/news/world-latin-america-29406630<br><br>HTTP://Latino.FoxNews.com/latino/news/2014/09/30/student-protests-in-central-mexico-leave-57-missing-6-dead-and-22-cops-arrested/<br><br>WWW.TheGuardian.com/world/2014/oct/23/mexican-mayor-disappearance-students-iguala<br><br>WWW.Telegraph.co.UK/news/worldnews/centralamericaandthecaribbean/mexico/11171233/Mexico-catches-chief-of-gang-in-missing-students-case.html<br><br>WWW.NYTimes.com/2014/10/29/world/americas/mexico-missing-students-search.html?_r=0<br><br>HTTP://OnLine.WSJ.com/articles/men-detained-over-missing-mexican-students-1414459271<br><br>HTTP://En.Wikipedia.org/wiki/Tlatelolco_massacre    </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-11T16:23:38+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Colin Paul Gloster</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;d5e5ed65.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;a77eae8e.1410">   <title><No subject> </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;a77eae8e.1410</link>   <description> Apologies for cross-posting<br><br>Redefining Equality and Diversity in the Information Age’<br>In association with Noon Centre for Equality and Diversity in Business, WeConnect International, UEL<br><br>This international conference provides an opportunity to share global perspectives and best practice; focusing primarily on exploring the impact of communication technologies on Equality and Diversity including community empowerment, freedoms, social and economic inclusion. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-17T10:31:54+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Adam Eardley</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;a77eae8e.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;530006f5.1410">   <title>Research focus for 2014: \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdRedefining Equality and Diversity in the Information Age\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;530006f5.1410</link>   <description> When: 4th November 2014: 10am-4.45 pm<br>Where: Level 32, 40 Bank Street, London, E14 5NR<br><br>The inaugural Global Equality and Diversity International Conference features global perspectives on Equality and Diversity facilitating sharing of knowledge and expertise between researchers and sector specific experts. The conference will offer the tools to stay up-to-date and at the forefront of good practice in equality, and will feature the latest research in the field. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-06T07:27:06+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Adam Eardley</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;530006f5.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;67cf4982.1410">   <title>Journal of Management Development Special Issue : Business and Sustainability </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;67cf4982.1410</link>   <description> ** APOLOGIES FOR CROSS POSTING **<br>Call for papers<br>Journal of Management Development<br>&quot;'Business and Sustainability: Innovating for a Better World'&quot;<br><br>Editors: Mark Smith1, Fabien Martinez2,3, Mark Esposito1,4 and Patrick O'Sullivan1<br>1Grenoble Ecole de Management 2Academy of Business in Society 3Vlerick Business School 4University of Cambridge, CISL<br>The special issue will focus on social innovation, with a particular attention to exploring the ways in which innovation can serve to create better and more integrated social, environmental and economic business enterprises. Decades of empirical and conceptual research into corporate social responsibility, sustainability, corporate citizenship and business ethics have ushered management thinkers [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-01T21:35:54+02:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>SMITH Mark</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;67cf4982.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;f03f78d0.1409">   <title>Research focus for 2014: \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdRedefining Equality and Diversity in the Information Age\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;f03f78d0.1409</link>   <description> Agenda<br><br>This agenda provides for Keynote speeches and breakout sessions each, filmed and supported by interactive web documentation.<br><br>The event will have an online audience and be interactively on demand managed/moderated for a period of 3 months after the conference and will start the cycle for the 2015 conference. The event will be live streamed and available on all internet enabled devices. If you would like to arrange an open licence for your department, university, company, study group or consultancy please take up the online licence option with the free place. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-25T13:37:21+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Adam Eardley</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;f03f78d0.1409</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;59548504.1409">   <title>Global Equality and Diversity Conference </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;59548504.1409</link>   <description> The inaugural Global Equality and Diversity International Conference features global perspectives on Equality and Diversity facilitating sharing of knowledge and expertise between researchers and sector specific experts. The conference will offer the tools to stay up-to-date and at the forefront of good practice in equality, and will feature the latest research in the field. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-15T16:16:33+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Adam Eardley</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;59548504.1409</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;10dcf970.1409">   <title>"White House takes notice of reproducibility in science, and wants your opinion" </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;10dcf970.1409</link>   <description> HTTP://RetractionWatch.com/2014/09/05/white-house-takes-notice-of-reproducibility-in-science-and-wants-your-opinion/    </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-11T15:22:59+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Colin Paul Gloster</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;10dcf970.1409</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;656becf5.1408">   <title>CfP - 3rd International Conference on E-Technologies and Business on the Web - FRANCE </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;656becf5.1408</link>   <description> CALL FOR PAPERS AND PARTICIPATION<br><br>The Third International Conference on E-Technologies and Business on the<br>Web<br>http://sdiwc.net/conferences/ebw2015/<br><br>Sponsored by the SDIWC (The Society of Digital Information and Wireless<br>Communications), the chair of Digital Business and the Research Lab of<br>ESG Management School, The Third International Conference on<br>e-Technologies and Business on the Web (EBW2015) will be held at the ESG<br>MS, Paris, France on March 26-28, 2015. This year, the conference<br>focuses on interdisciplinary conference on digital business and consumer<br>behavior. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-08-21T03:43:14-06:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Liezelle Ann</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;656becf5.1408</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;ece0e77c.1408">   <title>'Diversity: A Practitioners Journey Conference 2014' </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;ece0e77c.1408</link>   <description> Dear Guest,<br><br>The Middlesex University Business School would like to invite you to attend the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdDiversity\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd A Practitioners Journey Conference 2014 at Middlesex University on Tuesday 23rd September 2014.<br><br>Middlesex University Business School, in collaboration with Winmark, is delighted to invite you to a conference featuring leading academics, experts and practitioners discussing key issues surrounding diversity and inclusion during a day of lively debate at the University's modern Hendon campus.<br>Attending will be keynote speakers from a number of leading organisations, including the Civil Service, the BBC, the Institute of Directors, and Winmark. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-08-15T17:22:27+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Mita Vaghji</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;ece0e77c.1408</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;b8f89286.1408">   <title>'Diversity: A Practitioners Journey Conference 2014' </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;b8f89286.1408</link>   <description>Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;b8f89286.1408">'Diversity: A Practitioners Journey Conference 2014' </a></description>   <dc:date>2014-08-15T17:21:28+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Mita Vaghji</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;b8f89286.1408</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;b3abb0cd.1407">   <title>Mord ist Mord </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;b3abb0cd.1407</link>   <description> Dagny L\ufffd\ufffddemann bei DER ZEIT hatte am 17. Juli 2014 um 16:10 Uhr \ufffd\ufffdEin Embryo ist im Sinne des Gesetzes kein Mensch\ufffd\ufffd behauptet.<br><br>Ich habe am 18. Juli 2014 erkl\ufffd\ufffdrt -<br>\ufffd\ufffdEuphemismus ist ein Vorwand<br><br>Wissen Sie Bescheid, dass die SS J\ufffd\ufffddinnen als Untermenschen bezeichnet hat, also hat die SS diese faule Ausrede benutzt, um J\ufffd\ufffddinnen zu morden - nanu, abzut\ufffd\ufffdten -? Muslime machen dasselbe mittels der Scharia gegen Musliminnen - nanu, Sklavinnen -. Quacksalber machen dasselbe mittels der Morde - nanu, der Schwangerschaftsabbr\ufffd\ufffdche und der Gewinnungen von Zellen und der Menschenopfer - gegen Babys - nanu, Zellen -. Quacksalber [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-07-18T15:53:52+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Paul Colin Gloster</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;b3abb0cd.1407</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;633cf42.1407">   <title>Paywalls kill - death "for allegedly stealing academic papers" </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;633cf42.1407</link>   <description> Patricia Bauer, &quot;Aaron Swartz: Year In Review 2013&quot;, &quot;Encyclopaedia<br>Britannica Online&quot;,<br>WWW.Britannica.com/EBchecked/topic/1915026/Aaron-Swartz-Year-In-Review-2013/<br><br>Laura Collins, &quot;EXCLUSIVE - Last picture of tragic internet guru: Reddit<br>founder's girlfriend tells of their last hours&quot;, &quot;The Daily Mail&quot;, 2013,<br>WWW.DailyMail.co.UK/news/article-2264177/EXCLUSIVE-Girlfriend-Reddit-founder-hanged-tells-moment-body-hounded-vindictive-legal-system.html<br><br>HTTP://BelSec.SkyNetBlogs.Be/archive/2013/01/19/the-last-meal-of-swartz-with-his-girlfriend-before-hanging-h.html    </description>   <dc:date>2014-07-17T11:15:46+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Paul Colin Gloster</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;633cf42.1407</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;38533848.1407">   <title>Book: "False Feathers: A Perspective on Academic Plagiarism" </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;38533848.1407</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>A new book has been published: &quot;False Feathers: A Perspective on<br>Academic Plagiarism&quot; by Debora Weber-Wulff:<br>HTTP://Copy-Shake-Paste.BlogSpot.Pt/2014/03/unboxing.html<br><br>Ironically it is published by Springer.<br><br>Regards,<br>Paul Colin    </description>   <dc:date>2014-07-14T10:36:35+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Paul Colin Gloster</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;38533848.1407</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;60dc83c5.1407">   <title>"Science Journal Pulls 60 Papers in Peer-Review Fraud" </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;60dc83c5.1407</link>   <description> Apparently Asian editions of the &quot;International New-York Times&quot; carry<br>&quot;Science Journal Pulls 60 Papers in Peer-Review Fraud&quot;. Does anyone know<br>if a Spanish edition carries it? (Spanish editions of the &quot;International<br>Herald Tribune&quot; often lacked science stories by &quot;The New-York Times&quot;.)<br><br>I can not buy &quot;The [daily] Guardian&quot; here. Does anyone if &quot;The Guardian<br>Weekly&quot; has or shall cover this?    </description>   <dc:date>2014-07-11T19:59:37+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Paul Colin de Gloucester</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;60dc83c5.1407</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;357e0a4e.1406">   <title>Showcase your research by entering the CMI Management Articles of the Year </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;357e0a4e.1406</link>   <description> FIRST CALL FOR PAPERS Initial deadline 18th July 2014<br><br>Would you like to get guaranteed reviews for your articles from an audience of managers, wider publicity for your work and the chance to win \ufffd\ufffd1,000?<br><br>If so, submit a short article to the CMI Management Articles of the Year Award. This is a quick, no-fuss online submission of a 2,500 word article - and can include existing work, as long as you have cleared the copyright. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-06-30T09:33:38+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Piers Cain</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;357e0a4e.1406</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;8c2effb9.1406">   <title>Deadline extended - Social Innovation Summer School & SI Journal of Management Development, 17-19 Sept. 2014 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;8c2effb9.1406</link>   <description> [apologies for cross posting] ** Deadline extended **<br><br>INNOVATING FOR A BETTER WORLD<br><br>Social Innovation ABIS Doctoral Summer School &amp; Special Issue of the Journal of Management Development.<br><br>Grenoble Ecole de Management, 17-19 Sept 2014 http://abis-gem-dss.sciencesconf.org<br><br>The Academy of Business in Society (ABIS) Doctoral Summer School will focus on social innovation, with a particular interest in exploring the ways in which innovations can serve to create better and more integrated social, environmental and economic business enterprises. Social innovation implies an ability to create change that will enhance progress and sustainable human development. This includes, for example, institutional innovation regarding the [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-06-18T12:46:45+02:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>SMITH Mark</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BUSINESS-ETHICS;8c2effb9.1406</dc:identifier> </item>   </rdf:RDF>
